Quote: Crises marked by anxiety, doubt, and despair have always been those periods of personal unrest that occur at the times when a man is sufficiently unsettled to have an opportunity for personal growth. We must always see our own feelings of uneasiness as being our chance for "making the growth choice rather than the fear choice.
Author: Sheldon B. Kopp,  If You Meet the Buddha on the Road, Kill Him: The Pilgrimage Of Psychotherapy Patients
